      • calculateCellDensities

        public Statistic calculateCellDensities(int numberOfCellsInOneDimension,
                                        AxisIndexer indexer)
        count the number of points within each cell and do basic statistics on those counts.
        Parameters:
        numberOfCellsInOneDimension - number of cells across one dimension to divide the data into to count the number of points within each cell
        indexer -
        Returns:
        statistic the basic statistics of the point counts within the cells

      • fractionOfCellsOutSideOfAvgTolerance

        public float fractionOfCellsOutSideOfAvgTolerance(int numberOfCellsInOneDimension,
                                                  AxisIndexer indexer,
                                                  float factorStDev)
        return the fraction of cells whose counts are outside of average +- standardDeviation*factorStDev
        Parameters:
        numberOfCellsInOneDimension - number of cells across one dimension to divide the data into to count the number of points within each cell
        indexer -
        factorStDev - the factor to test whether a cell's counts are within average += stDev*factorStDev. factorStDev is usually a value of 2 or 3. The value should be equal to TwoPointCorrelation.sigmaFactor.
        Returns:
        whether all of the counts within cells are similar within one standard deviation

      • fractionOfCellsOutSideOfAvgTolerance

        public float fractionOfCellsOutSideOfAvgTolerance(Statistic statistic,
                                                  float factorStDev)
        return the fraction of cells whose counts are outside of average +- standardDeviation*factorStDev
        Parameters:
        statistic -
        factorStDev - the factor to test whether a cell's counts are within average += stDev*factorStDev. factorStDev is usually a value of 2 or 3. The value should be equal to TwoPointCorrelation.sigmaFactor.
        Returns:
        whether all of the counts within cells are similar within one standard deviation

      • doesNotHaveLargeGaps

        public boolean doesNotHaveLargeGaps(int numberOfCellsInOneDimension,
                                    AxisIndexer indexer,
                                    float factorStDev)
        determine whether counts in each cell suggest that there are gaps in the data, that is whether some cells have significantly fewer counts than others.
        Parameters:
        numberOfCellsInOneDimension -
        indexer -
        factorStDev - the factor to test whether a cell's counts are within average += stDev*factorStDev. factorStDev is usually a value of 2 or 3. The value should be equal to TwoPointCorrelation.sigmaFactor.
        Returns:
        whether there are not cells with significantly fewer points in them than average

      • doesNotHaveLargeGaps

        public boolean doesNotHaveLargeGaps(Statistic statistic,
                                    float factorStDev)
        determine whether counts in each cell suggest that there are gaps in the data, that is whether some cells have significantly fewer counts than others.
        Parameters:
        statistic -
        factorStDev - the factor to test whether a cell's counts are within average += stDev*factorStDev. factorStDev is usually a value of 2 or 3. The value should be equal to TwoPointCorrelation.sigmaFactor.
        Returns:
        whether there are not cells with significantly fewer points in them than average

      • fractionOfCellsWithoutPoints

        public float fractionOfCellsWithoutPoints(Statistic statistic)
        determine whether counts in each cell suggest that there are gaps in the data, that is whether some cells have significantly fewer counts than others.
        Parameters:
        statistic -
        Returns:
        whether there are not cells with significantly fewer points in them than average

      • chooseARandomDiagonalCell

        public int[] chooseARandomDiagonalCell(int numberOfCellsInOneDimension,
                                       AxisIndexer indexer)
        choose randomly a diagonal cell from a grid of size (Math.sqrt(indexer.nXY)/numberOfCellsInOneDimension)^2. the indexes are diagonal, but the location of the points is not (unless the data are in a grid, that is)
        Parameters:
        numberOfCellsInOneDimension -
        indexer -
        Returns:
        start and end indexes w.r.t. indexer.sortedXIndexes

      • chooseARandomCell

        public int[] chooseARandomCell(int numberOfCellsInOneDimension,
                               AxisIndexer indexer)
        choose a random cell within the data were a cell is a division of the data by numberOfCellsInOneDimension for each dimension. it returns the cell boundaries in x and then y as indexes that are indexes relative to {indexer.getSortedXIndexes(), indexer.getSortedXIndexes(), indexer.getSortedYIndexes(), indexer.getSortedYIndexes()}
        Parameters:
        numberOfCellsInOneDimension -
        indexer -
        Returns:
        an array holding the index boundaries of the cell as new int[]{xIndexLo, int xIndexHi, int yIndexLo, int yIndexHi} where the indexes should be treated with respect to arrays {indexer.getSortedXIndexes(), indexer.getSortedXIndexes(), indexer.getSortedYIndexes(), indexer.getSortedYIndexes()}
